question_answer.statement: The 2009 Honduras earthquake had a magnitude of 7.3 and was the strongest earthquake felt in Honduras in the past 3 decades.
The 2009 Honduras earthquake occurred due to right-lateral strike-slip faulting.
Seismological records in Honduras are abundant and of high quality.

question_answer.question: What was a significant local site effect observed during the 2009 Honduras earthquake?
options: A. Damage to the Supreme Court Building due to soft foundation soils
B. Widespread liquefaction in mountainous regions
C. No damage reported in any structures
D. Increased seismic activity in neighboring countries

question_answer.question: What was a significant effect of the earthquake on the port facilities in Honduras?
options: A. Widespread liquefaction and surface rupture of fill materials
B. Complete destruction of all port facilities
C. No damage reported at the port
D. Increase in port operations

question_answer.question: What was a significant consequence of the earthquake in the Valle de Sula region?
options: A. Damage to the levee system
B. Increased agricultural yield
C. Improved urban infrastructure
D. Decreased flood risk

question_answer.statement: Infill walls are load-bearing elements that can provide additional shear strength during an earthquake.
The 2009 Honduras earthquake caused structural damage due to local site effects and aseismic design.

question_answer.question: What was the primary cause of the collapse of the middle span of the La Democracia bridge?
options: A. Inadequate seating and lack of lateral restraint
B. Poor construction materials
C. Flooding from the Ulua River
D. Earthquake magnitude too low to cause damage

question_answer.question: What was a significant structural issue observed in the bridges during the 2009 Honduras earthquake?
options: A. Diagonal cracks in shear keys
B. Complete destruction of the bridges
C. No visible damage
D. Increased height of the bridges

question_answer.statement: The El Cajon Dam experienced significant deformation during the earthquake event in 2009.
The dam safety instrumentation indicated that the structure was unsafe after the earthquake event.
